title: Tennis Professional
description:
Mountainside Racquet Club, a tennis club located 30 minutes from Manhattan, is seeking a staff pro to teach junior programs, work the front desk during USTA tournaments, and string racquets. The person applying for the job must have junior and college playing experience. This position is ideal for the person who wants to work in a team environment and join an organization that is growing. We offer medical and 401K benefits, and compensation is based on experience.
  
  

Phone calls will not be accepted.

title: High Performance Tennis Coach
description: Mountainside Racquet Club, a tennis club located 30 minutes from Manhattan, is seeking a High Performance Coach with ATP, ITF or NCAA experience, to work in our successful High Performance program. This position is ideal for the person who wants to work in a team environment and wants to join an organization that is growing and on solid financial footing. In addition, we offer medical and 401K benefits, and compensation is based on experience. Phone calls will not be accepted.

title: Childcare Apprentice Middlesex
description:
**Benefits:**  

* Competitive salary
* Flexible schedule
* Opportunity for advancement
* Paid time off

  

Join our dynamic team and embark on a fulfilling journey as a paid apprentice! If you're passionate about working with children and eager to develop personally and professionally, this opportunity is tailor-made for you. We specialize in providing in-home and community-based supportive and therapeutic services for youth with developmental disabilities. Our innovative program harnesses the power of sports, fitness, and recreational activities to empower children aged 3-20. As an apprentice, you'll enjoy the flexibility to create your own schedule based on your availability.  

  

**Responsibilities:**  

  

As a Childcare Apprentice, you'll receive comprehensive training to kickstart your career in childcare, social work, psychology, nursing, or other roles within the mental and medical healthcare fields. Your primary role will be to offer temporary relief to families caring for children with developmental disabilities in their homes. Through a creative and compassionate approach, you'll enhance the well-being of these children and provide support to families facing daily challenges.  

  

**Required Qualifications:**  

  

Demonstrated willingness to learn and a strong drive for professional growth.  

  

A genuine passion for mentoring children, particularly those with special needs.  

  

Availability during weekends and after-school hours.  

  

Ability to handle multiple youth simultaneously.  

  

High school diploma with some post-high school education.  

  

Proven ability to employ creative problem-solving and conflict resolution strategies.  

  

Experience in childcare or adult care.  

  

Must be at least eighteen years old to provide in-home respite care.  

  

Customer service experience.  

  

Current CPR/BLS certification.  

  

Negative Tuberculin Skin Test results.  

  

Bilingual skills are a plus.  

  

*Don't miss out on this incredible opportunity! Complete the application form and make sure to provide detailed responses to all the questions to be considered. We look forward to welcoming you to our team!*

title: Operations Assistant
description:
Housing Works requires employees working in our Health Services division to be fully vaccinated against COVID-19, unless approved for a legal accommodation. If you need an accommodation for any reason, including related to this job requirement, please contact Human Resources.

  

  

Job candidates should be aware that scammers may pose as employers and create fake job postings in order to extract personal information from individuals for financial gain. Housing Works will never ask job candidates for personal information, such as social security numbers or bank account details, over the phone. If you suspect that a job posting may be fake or wish to confirm that a job posting from Housing Works is genuine, please contact us at recruitment@housingworks.org


Housing Works was founded in 1990; With a long-term commitment to AIDS advocacy. Housing Works established New York State’s first harm reduction-based, OASAS-licensed outpatient drug treatment program. Other services include Health Home care management, behavioral health, and syringe exchange programs. A pioneer in the social entrepreneurship movement, Housing Works operates 10 high-end thrift shops in Manhattan and Brooklyn and a much-loved Bookstore Cafe in Soho. For more information, visit www.housingworks.org

  

  

Housing Works fights for funding and legislation to ensure that all people living with HIV/AIDS have access to quality housing, healthcare, HIV prevention, and treatment, among other lifesaving services.

  

  

**Benefits:**  

We have three comprehensive healthcare plans to choose from based on your priorities and budget. Housing Works covers most of the plan; you pay a portion, based on your salary. Staff begins accruing PTO immediately for a total of up to 30 days earned in the first year. We offer employees an educational benefit. This money is available for tuition loan reimbursement, tuition costs, and text books.

  

  

Housing Works provides equal employment opportunities (EEO) to all employees and applicants for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, age, disability or genetics. In addition to federal law requirements. Housing Works complies with applicable state and local laws governing nondiscrimination in employment in every location in which the company has facilities. Housing Works also does not request prior salary information during the hiring process. This policy applies to all terms and conditions of employment, including recruiting, hiring, placement, promotion, termination, layoff, recall, transfer, leaves of absence, compensation and training.

  

  

This position is included in a bargaining unit of Housing Works’ New York City employees represented by a labor union known as the Retail Wholesale and Department Store Union (“RWDSU”). Accordingly, the RWDSU has the exclusive right to bargain over the terms and conditions of employment related to this position and this position may become covered by the terms of a collective bargaining agreement (a “CBA”) between Housing Works and the RWDSU

 **Compensation: $17/hr**

 **Overview:**


Summary Description The Operations Assistant is responsible for making repairs and performing maintenance in scatter site apartments, program offices and or Congregate sites in the STH Portfolio. The Operations Assistant performs apartment turnovers and help our clients pack their belongings and move. The Operations Assistant must drive throughout NYC as a part of their daily duties.

 **Responsibilities:**


Primary:

* Perform repair and maintenance tasks in our clients’ apartments, including, but not limited to, plastering, sanding, painting, repairing sheetrock, plumbing, changing locks, and replacing fixtures.


Secondary:

* Assist in the apartment/room turnover process by preparing apartments for new residents including, but not limited to, cleaning floors, cleaning refrigerators, cleaning bathrooms, cleaning ovens and stoves, and removing garbage and furniture.


Other functions that may be required with this position include:

* Assisting program clients pack, move, and unpack their personal belongings to a new apartment.
* Delivering furniture and supplies to clients
* Responding to Work Orders and updating Salesforce as needed.
* Always representing Housing Works in a professional manner.
* Extending a professional, warm, and respectful attitude towards clients
* Meeting vendors and tradespeople at client apartments and ensuring the work is done properly
* Participating in advocacy and direct action to end the twin crises of homelessness and HIV/AIDS.


Minimum Requirements
* High School Diploma or GED is required.


Qualifications/ Requirements

* Experience with and proven commitment to working with low-income and marginalized communities, as well as individuals with multiple chronic medical and/or behavioral health conditions.
* Clean NYS Driver’s License Competencies
* Dependable and flexible
* Able to maintain a high level of client confidentiality.
* Excellent internal and external customer service skills
* Ability to prioritize and multi-task.
* Must be proficient in Microsoft Outlook, Word, and Excel.
* Exemplary time management skills.
* Ability to work with colleagues to solve problems.
company_description: Housing Works is a healing community of people living with and affected by HIV/AIDS.

title: Sunglass Hut - Store Manager I - Monmouth Mall-Macy's - NJ - 6253
description:
**Requisition ID:** 854467  

**Store #**: 006253 Sunglass Hut MACYS  

**Position:**Full-Time  

At Sunglass Hut, we're always in the sun. You’ll find a dynamic space with endless possibilities to grow your career. We are a culture that wants to see you succeed, develop your customer expertise and care, and feel supported by people who embrace you. With us, you’ll bring warmth into the hearts and souls of our customers and the world we live in. We believe in the freedom of self-expression, inclusivity and authenticity, which is why we bring exclusive styles of high-quality fashion and performance sunglasses to all.  


A world leader in the specialty sunglass retail business with over 3,000 stores worldwide, we believe in the freedom of self-expression, inclusivity and authenticity, which is why we bring exclusive styles of high-quality fashion and performance sunglasses to all.  


Sunglass Hut is part of EssilorLuxottica, a global leader in the design, manufacture and distribution of ophthalmic lenses, frames and sunglasses.
**GENERAL FUNCTION**The Store Manager is an on-the-floor leader, not only performing all store functions, but also acting as a guide and role model for the team. Coaches, develops and inspires the team so that everyone working in the store serves as a true ambassador for Sunglass Hut.  



The Store Manager creats an environment where everyone delivers great service through The Sunglass Hut Experience. The Store Manager’s leadership, energy and willingness to make quick decisions inspires every store Associate to deliver The Sunglass Hut Experience that translates into sales.  


**MAJOR DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES**
* Utilizes The Sunglass Hut Experience tools to consistently deliver sales plan and company objectives.
* Develops the store’s strategic plan to achieve financial results.
* Drives sales by continually identifying opportunities to achieve both personal and store goals.
* Leads by example by coaching, developing, mentoring and inspiring the team to enhance store performance.
* People work for people – uses this philosophy to grow careers, encourage teamwork and retain talent through a development-focused environment.
* Networks, recruits, hires to staffing needs, and trains using the onboarding tools provided as part of The Sunglass Hut Experience.
* Inspires team growth through individual development plans.
* Creates an inspirational and motivating work environment that reflects the integrity of the brand.
* Creates an EMOTIONAL CONNECTION within the store team that translates into sales and ensures every Associate consistently delivers The Sunglass Hut Experience.
* Spends an average of 100% of time present on the sales floor.
* Continually coaches and develops the team to ensure consistent and absolute execution of The Sunglass Hut Experience.
* Develops customer relationships through interaction and feedback.
* Acts as an ambassador for the Sunglass Hut brand.
* Builds the Sunglass Hut brand by consistently executing the brand standards.
* Stays adept at knowing the product and staying curious on new merchandise and fashion trends.
* Motivates, coaches, and inspires thei team and ensures they are the best possible brand ambassadors.
* Ensures impeccable execution of operational policies and procedures, and maintains brand standards.
* Continually coaches and develops to ensure retail excellence.
* Communicates information regarding promotions, contests, and incentives to the team.

  


**BASIC QUALIFICATIONS**
* High school diploma or equivalent
* Previous leadership experience of 2+ years
* Demonstrated expertise in every aspect of store operations
* Detail-oriented
* Ability to use critical thinking to deliver absolute execution of the operational components of the store

  


**PREFERRED QUALIFICATIONS**
* Customer service and/or retail experience


Pay Range: - 30.32  


Employee pay is determined by multiple factors, including geography, experience, qualifications, skills and local minimum wage requirements. In addition, you may also be offered a competitive bonus and/or commission plan, which complements a first-class total rewards package. Benefits may include health care, retirement savings, paid time off/vacation, and various employee discounts.  


Upon request and consistent with applicable laws, EssilorLuxottica will provide reasonable accommodations to individuals with disabilities who need assistance in the application and hiring process. To request a reasonable accommodation, please call the EssilorLuxottica SpeakUp Hotline at 844-303-0229 ( (be sure to provide your name and contact information so that we may follow up in a timely manner) or email HRCompliance@luxotticaretail.com.  


We are an Equal Opportunity Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, gender, national origin, social origin, social condition, being perceived as a victim of domestic violence, sexual aggression or stalking, religion, age, disability, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, citizenship, ancestry, veteran or military status, marital status, pregnancy (including unlawful discrimination on the basis of a legally protected pregnancy or maternity leave), genetic information or any other characteristics protected by law. Native Americans in the US receive preference in accordance with Tribal Law.

title: Prudential: 2025 U.S. Businesses, Leadership Development Program
description:
Job Classification:
Project Mgmt, Transformation & Strategy - Project Mgmt, Transformation & Strategy
Prudential: 2025 U.S. Businesses, Leadership Development Program
Location(s):
Newark, NJ (Hybrid)
Prudential Financial, Inc. (NYSE: PRU), a global financial services leader and premier active global investment manager with approximately $1.5 trillion in assets under management as of March 31, 2024, has operations in the United States, Asia, Europe, and Latin America. Prudential’s diverse and talented employees help make lives better and create financial opportunity for more people by expanding access to investing, insurance, and retirement security. Prudential’s iconic Rock symbol has stood for strength, stability, expertise, and innovation for nearly 150 years. For more information, please visit news.prudential.com.
The U.S. Businesses include Individual Life Insurance, Group Insurance, Retirement Strategies, and Retail Advice & Solutions, and Marketing. These businesses provide a range of income, protection, and advice offerings. They are supported by the Enabling Solutions organization delivering an end-to-end customer experience that's simple, proactive, and data-driven to fuel financial wellness solutions for our customers.
What to Expect:
Prudential wants to offer you an outstanding opportunity to develop through an 18-month rotational program in U.S Businesses which is designed to help accelerate critical business skills and leadership capabilities. The experience gained within the program will help U.S. Businesses future talent.
Our program offers three 6-month rotations within the U.S. Businesses and is structured to give you a broad background through meaningful exposure focused in areas such as Product Development & Innovation, Sales, Customer Experience, and more.
Your Day to Day:
You will work in a collaborative and encouraging environment that promotes and rewards individual contributions, while placing equal importance on the results of the larger team.
Your 6-month rotations while in program will be within the following or other areas and may vary based on the business need as well as candidate interest and skills:* Product Development & Innovation: These are tech-savvy pioneers with one eye on what’s new—and the other on what’s next. Whether you work on a product team or lead one, you’ll oversee combining of key insights about our customers with Prudential’s overall business strategy. Our talent is passionate about developing innovative products that bring ingenuity, simplicity, and humanity to Prudential—and to our customers.
* Customer Experience: Being customer focused is a driving force in our enterprise strategy as we build an industry leading experience to be competitive in the market and to drive top-line growth. Prudential has embarked on a journey to bring customer focus beyond a cultural aspiration and to use it to fundamentally challenge how we run our business and priorities.
* Sales: Our Sales and Distribution professionals play the vital and highly visible role of showcasing our integrated products and solutions, which optimally drives Prudential’s customer engagement and execution. We use our talent, capabilities, and unmatched brand to fulfill our purpose of making lives better and solving the financial challenges of our constantly evolving world.
* Marketing: As a storyteller, Prudential’s marketing team is at the heart of business strategy and campaign development. Balancing creativity with customer insights, our marketing professionals stay focused on connecting customers with the financial wellness and investment solutions they need to plan for long-term. Our dynamic, collaborative teams help Prudential engage with our ecosystem of partners, curate our reputation, and advocate for the issues that matter to our customers, employees, and businesses.


Required Qualifications:* Candidates must be enrolled in an accredited bachelor’s program graduating between December 2024 and May 2025
* Preferred areas of study: Business, Economics, Management, Business Analytics, Operations, Entrepreneurship
* Prudential does not provide visa sponsorship for this position. Successful candidates must possess the requisite US employment authorization to be eligible for consideration.


Preferred Qualifications:
We are seeking a dynamic individual who embodies agility, business curiosity, and a relentless drive for innovation. While in the U.S. Businesses Leadership Development Program you will thrive in complex and ambiguous environments, bringing bold and innovative thinking to accelerate growth in the businesses.
This person holds the below attributes:* Continuous learner that challenges the status quo through innovative solutions.
* Demonstrated openness to change and ability to adapt quickly to changing environments.
* Strong curiosity and knowledge of business acumen, leveraging data and insights to drive decisions.
* Exceptional critical thinking skills to solve complex problems effectively.
* Collaborative mindset, with the ability to work across peer groups and various levels of management.
* Excellent written, oral communication, and interpersonal skills.
* Ability to manage complexity in assignments and deliver results under pressure.


Our Application Process:
Submit your application. If eligible, receive invitation for a digital interview; this includes answering pre-recorded interview questions with the business(es) that advance your application(s). If advanced, receive invitation for final round interview(s); you will have the opportunity to meet with us in person or virtually to learn more about our business and culture.
For 2025 early talent roles, our process is designed to help you learn more about Prudential/PGIM and share your story with us. Digital interviewing allows greater flexibility, enables a quicker interview process, allows us to meet more candidates and share your story with more members of the team.
Note: The salary range for this role is $67,500 to $72,500. Specific pricing for the role may vary within the above range based on many factors including geographic location, candidate experience, and skills. Roles may also be eligible for additional compensation and/or benefits. Eligibility to participate in a discretionary annual incentive program is subject to the rules governing the program, whereby an award, if any, depends on various factors including, without limitation, individual and organizational performance.
Prudential Financial, Inc. of the United States is not affiliated with Prudential plc. which is headquartered in the United Kingdom.
Prudential is a multinational financial services leader with operations in the United States, Asia, Europe, and Latin America. Leveraging its heritage of life insurance and asset management expertise, Prudential is focused on helping individual and institutional customers grow and protect their wealth. The company's well-known Rock symbol is an icon of strength, stability, expertise and innovation that has stood the test of time. Prudential's businesses offer a variety of products and services, including life insurance, annuities, retirement-related services, mutual funds, asset management, and real estate services.
We recognize that our strength and success are directly linked to the quality and skills of our diverse associates. We are proud to be a place where talented people who want to make a difference can grow as professionals, leaders, and as individuals. Visit www.prudential.com to learn more about our values, our history and our brand.
Prudential is an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, national origin, ancestry, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, genetics, disability, marital status, age, veteran status, domestic partner status , medical condition or any other characteristic protected by law.
The Prudential Insurance Company of America, Newark, NJ and its affiliates.
Note that this posting is intended for individual applicants. Search firms or agencies should email Staffing at staffingagencies@prudential.com for more information about doing business with Prudential.
PEOPLE WITH DISABILITIES:

Please note that the above email is solely for individuals with disabilities requesting an accommodation. If you are experiencing a technical issue with your application or an assessment, please email careers.technicalsupport@prudential.com to request assistance.

title: Prudential: 2025 Technology & Data, Data Analytics & Business Systems Internship Program
description:
Job Classification:
Technology - Engineering & Cloud
Prudential: 2025 Technology & Data, Data Analytics & Business Systems Internship Program
Location(s):
Newark, NJ (Hybrid)
Prudential Financial, Inc. (NYSE: PRU), a global financial services leader and premier active global investment manager with approximately $1.5 trillion in assets under management as of March 31, 2024, has operations in the United States, Asia, Europe, and Latin America. Prudential’s diverse and talented employees help make lives better and create financial opportunity for more people by expanding access to investing, insurance, and retirement security. Prudential’s iconic Rock symbol has stood for strength, stability, expertise, and innovation for nearly 150 years. For more information, please visit news.prudential.com.
Are you interested in building capabilities that enable the organization with innovation, speed, agility, scalability, and efficiency? The Technology & Data team takes great pride in our culture where digital transformation is built into our DNA! When you join our organization at Prudential, you’ll unlock an exciting and impactful career – all while growing your skills and advancing your profession at one of the world’s leading financial services institutions.
Timeline:
The internship program will run from Monday, June 2nd, 2025, to Friday, August 8th, 2025.
We review applications on a rolling basis, and we encourage you to apply as soon as you are ready. All fall applications will close on or by Friday, October 4th, 2024, at midnight ET. We reserve the right to close applications early due to volume or role(s) being filled.*Applications for PGIM Investment Professional roles are open as of July 1st. All other businesses will open on August 2nd**.* To ensure you are considered for the opportunities you want most, you are only able to apply to 3 positions per recruitment season.
What You Can Expect:
At Prudential, we are committed to nurturing the next generation of technology leaders. As a Data Analytics & Business Systems Intern in Technology & Data, you will work alongside product owners, tech leads, designers, engineers, and delivery professionals to improve our suite of information systems and data analysis tools. You will act as the primary interface between Technology and specific business areas, or corporate functions, identifying business unit requirements, creating process specifications, coordinating with project teams, and ensuring adherence to schedules and budgets to deploy innovative products, services, and experiences to ultimately impact our customers and business strategies!
Join a team and culture where your voice matters; where every day, your work transforms our experiences to make lives better. As you put your skills to use, we’ll help you make an even bigger impact with learning experiences that can grow your technical AND leadership capabilities. You’ll be surprised by what this rock-solid organization has in store for you. For the internship program, you may be placed in one of the following areas, but will have exposure to all Technology & Data:* Corporate Technology (CT)
* Chief Operating Office (COO)
* U.S. Businesses


Your Typical Day:* Collaborate with product owners in understanding needs and defining feature stories, tech leads in defining technical design and other team members to understand the system end-to-end and deliver robust solutions that bring about business impact
* Assist in developing user stories, process designs and logical data models in support of agile delivery teams
* Exploring and leveraging external research, business systems, and data tools like Microsoft Office Suite, SQL, Tableau, Power BI, R, SAS, Hadoop, ETL, API development and microservices
* Managing information systems, building strong data foundations, identifying regression trends, and performing data segmentation


The goal of the summer internship is to identify and pipeline top technology talent for our full-time, two-year leadership rotation program. Through high-impact experiences and diverse rotations focused on engineering and data skills, the full-time program develops you for future leadership roles. The program combines on‐the‐job training with formal education experiences, special project assignments, mentoring, coaching and engagement with senior leaders.  

Required Qualifications:* Candidates must be enrolled in an accredited bachelor’s program graduating between December 2025 and May 2027
* Prudential does not provide visa sponsorship for this position. Successful candidates must possess the requisite US employment authorization to be eligible for consideration


Preferred Qualifications:* Relevant majors include Business Analytics, Data Analytics, Economics, Finance, Mathematics, Management Information Systems, and Statistics; And we welcome all other technical or business areas of study to apply!
* Leverage diverse ideas, experiences, thoughts, and perspectives to the benefit of the organization
* Ability to learn new skills and knowledge on an ongoing basis through self-initiative and tackling challenges
* Familiarity and/or interest with the following: Adobe Analytics, Google Analytics, R, Power BI, Python, AWS, Text Mining Tools, Tableau, SQL, Splunk, Sagemaker, S3, Glue, Redshift


Our Application Process:
1. Submit your application.
2. If eligible, receive invitation for a digital interview; this includes answering pre-recorded interview questions with the business(es) that advance your application(s).
3. If advanced, receive invitation for final round interview(s); you will have the opportunity to meet with us in person or virtually to learn more about our business and culture.
For 2025 early talent roles, our process is designed to help you learn more about Prudential/PGIM and share your story with us. Digital interviewing allows greater flexibility, enables a quicker interview process, allows us to meet more candidates and share your story with more members of the team.
Note: The hourly range for this role is $36.00 to $38.00. Specific pricing for the role may vary within the above range based on many factors including geographic location, candidate experience, and skills. Roles may also be eligible for additional compensation and/or benefits. Eligibility to participate in a discretionary annual incentive program is subject to the rules governing the program, whereby an award, if any, depends on various factors including, without limitation, individual and organizational performance.

Prudential is a multinational financial services leader with operations in the United States, Asia, Europe, and Latin America. The company's well-known Rock symbol is an icon of strength, stability, expertise and innovation that has stood the test of time. Prudential's businesses offer a variety of products and services, including life insurance, annuities, retirement-related services, mutual funds, asset management, and real estate services.

title: Prudential: 2025 Corporate, Finance Leadership Development Program
description:
Job Classification:
Finance & Accounting - Finance & Accounting
Prudential: 2025 Corporate, Finance Leadership Development Program (FLDP)
Location(s):
Newark, NJ (Hybrid)
Prudential Financial, Inc. (NYSE: PRU), a global financial services leader and premier active global investment manager with approximately $1.5 trillion in assets under management as of March 31, 2024, has operations in the United States, Asia, Europe, and Latin America. Prudential’s diverse and talented employees help make lives better and create financial opportunity for more people by expanding access to investing, insurance, and retirement security. Prudential’s iconic Rock symbol has stood for strength, stability, expertise, and innovation for nearly 150 years. For more information, please visit news.prudential.com.
Are you looking to apply your Finance, Accounting and/or tech systems knowledge to achieve strategic goals in a corporate finance organization? Or maybe you’re looking to gain foundational knowledge and skills to apply in a professional environment, while developing strong relationships through training, mentorship, and ongoing feedback. At Prudential that’s a challenge we can help you meet as a member of our Finance Leadership Development Program (FLDP).
The vision of Global Finance is to be the preeminent Finance team in Financial Services. Our Mission is to enable superior value propositions for Customers, Investors and Employees. We support business growth strategies & initiatives within U.S. Financial Wellness, PGIM, and International. FLDP is our full-time, rotational program in Corporate Finance, and focuses on developing future leaders by combining on‐the‐job training with formal training classes, special project assignments, mentoring and coaching. As a FLDP Associate, you will find yourself in a line of business or a Corporate Finance function, analyzing data while working side-by-side with other FLDP Associates and business leaders. You are given substantial responsibilities and will have the opportunity to present your newly learned skills to your team during this three-year rotational experience.
Your Day to Day:* Applying classroom knowledge to support the reconciliation and analysis of financial results
* Collaborating with business partners on key deliverables
* Analyzing current financial operations and initiate efforts to improve process efficiencies
* Assist in special projects, initiatives and ad-hoc report and analysis requests


Required Qualifications:* Candidates must be enrolled in an accredited bachelor’s program graduating between December 2024 and May 2025 and a current 2024 Summer Internship Experience (SIE) intern
* Preferred areas of study: Finance, Economics, Business, Accounting, Information Technology, Information Systems, MIS, and/or Operations.
* Preferred minimum 3.2 GPA
* Prudential does not provide visa sponsorship for this position. Successful candidates must possess the requisite US employment authorization to be eligible for consideration


Preferred Qualifications:* Strong technology aptitude and knowledge in Finance
* Strong ability to adapt to changing environment, think critically to solve problems, collaborate across peer groups and different levels of management.
* Experience in leading ideas, teams, and initiatives
* Strong written, oral communication, and interpersonal skills

Technology - Engineering & Cloud
Prudential: 2025 Technology & Data, Software Engineering Internship Program
Location(s):
Newark, NJ (Hybrid)
Prudential Financial, Inc. (NYSE: PRU), a global financial services leader and premier active global investment manager with approximately $1.5 trillion in assets under management as of March 31, 2024, has operations in the United States, Asia, Europe, and Latin America. Prudential’s diverse and talented employees help make lives better and create financial opportunity for more people by expanding access to investing, insurance, and retirement security. Prudential’s iconic Rock symbol has stood for strength, stability, expertise, and innovation for nearly 150 years. For more information, please visit news.prudential.com.
Are you interested in building capabilities that enable the organization with innovation, speed, agility, scalability, and efficiency? The Technology & Data team takes great pride in our culture where digital transformation is built into our DNA! When you join our organization at Prudential, you’ll unlock an exciting and impactful career – all while growing your skills and advancing your profession at one of the world’s leading financial services institutions.
Timeline:
The internship program will run from Monday, June 2nd, 2025, to Friday, August 8th, 2025.
We review applications on a rolling basis, and we encourage you to apply as soon as you are ready. All fall applications will close on or by Friday, October 4th, 2024, at midnight ET. We reserve the right to close applications early due to volume or role(s) being filled.*Applications for PGIM Investment Professional roles are open as of July 1st. All other businesses will open on August 2nd**.* To ensure you are considered for the opportunities you want most, you are only able to apply to 3 positions per recruitment season.
What You Can Expect:
At Prudential, we are committed to nurturing the next generation of technology leaders. As a Software Engineer Intern in Technology & Data, you will work alongside and partner with product owners, tech leads, designers, architects, and delivery professionals to drive meaningful outcomes. You will code, test and debug new and existing applications as you implement capabilities to solve sophisticated business problems, deploy innovative products, services, and experiences to ultimately impact our customers and business strategies!
Join a team and culture where your voice matters; where every day, your work transforms our experiences to make lives better. As you put your skills to use, we’ll help you make an even bigger impact with learning experiences that can grow your technical AND leadership capabilities. You’ll be surprised by what this rock-solid organization has in store for you. For the internship program, you may be placed in one of the following areas, but will have exposure to all Technology & Data:* Corporate Technology (CT)
* Architecture
* Chief Technology Office (CTO)
* Chief Operating Office (COO)
* Information Security Office (ISO)
* U.S. Businesses (USB)


Your Typical Day:* Build applications ensuring that the code follows latest coding practices and industry standards, using modern design patterns and architectural principles; with guidance, actively code and execute against the roadmap
* Develop high quality, well documented and efficient code adhering to all applicable Prudential standards
* Collaborate with product owners in understanding needs and defining feature stories, tech leads in defining technical design and other team members to understand the system end-to-end and deliver robust solutions that bring about business impact
* Write unit, integration tests and functional automation, researching problems discovered by quality assurance or product support
* Continue to advance understanding of relevant and emerging technologies with learning and innovation embedded in the day-to-day
* Work on problems of moderate scope in which analysis of situation or data requires a review of identifiable factors
* Use programming languages and frameworks including but not limited to Python, Java or JavaScript, Shell/Power scripting, Groovy, Ansible, CloudFormation, React, Springboot, Node.js Terraform
* Use agile software methodology for speed to market and iterative development


The goal of the summer internship is to identify and pipeline top technology talent for our two-year leadership rotation program. Through high-impact experiences and diverse rotations focused on engineering and data skills, the full-time program develops you for future leadership roles. The program combines on‐the‐job training with formal education experiences, special project assignments, mentoring, coaching and engagement with senior leaders.  

Required Qualifications:* Candidates must be enrolled in an accredited bachelor’s program graduating between December 2025 and May 2027
* Prudential does not provide visa sponsorship for this position. Successful candidates must possess the requisite US employment authorization to be eligible for consideration


Preferred Qualifications:* Relevant majors include Computer Science, Computer Engineering, Engineering, Mathematics, and Statistics; we welcome all other technical areas of study that include programming theory in your curriculum
* Leverage diverse ideas, experiences, thoughts, and perspectives to the benefit of the organization
* Ability to learn new skills and knowledge on an on-going basis through self-initiative and tackling on challenges
* Familiarity and interest with the following:
	+ Programming languages, technology stacks and/or data tools such as: Python, Java or JavaScript, React, Springboot, Node.js, MongoDB, Splunk, SQL, Tableau, Full / MEAN / MERN stack, SQS, Kinesis
	+ Object-oriented design concepts, data structures, and algorithms
	+ AWS Core Services: AWS Services such as CloudWatch, Code-Deploy
	+ Application Programming Interfaces (API)
	+ Unit, interface and end user testing concepts and tooling (functional & non-functional)
	+ Automated testing
	+ Accessibility awareness
	+ Software security skills including secure coding, web application security and DevSecOps
	+ Dev Ops Tools & Practices: GitHub, Bitbucket or Subversion; DevOps, Jenkins
	+ Software Development Life Cycle (SDLC): Monitoring and logging techniques
	+ Agile methodology including Agile Scrum, Kanban, or Lean
	+ AWS Core Services: AWS Services such as CloudWatch, Code-Deploy


Our Application Process:
1. Submit your application.
2. If eligible, receive invitation for a digital interview; this includes answering pre-recorded interview questions with the business(es) that advance your application(s).
3. If advanced, receive invitation for final round interview(s); you will have the opportunity to meet with us in person or virtually to learn more about our business and culture.
For 2025 early talent roles, our process is designed to help you learn more about Prudential/PGIM and share your story with us. Digital interviewing allows greater flexibility, enables a quicker interview process, allows us to meet more candidates and share your story with more members of the team.

Specific pricing for the role may vary within the above range based on many factors including geographic location, candidate experience, and skills. title: Prudential: 2025 Corporate, Chief Investment Office
description:
Job Classification:
Investment Management - Investments
Prudential: 2025 Corporate, Chief Investment Office (CIO) Analyst Program
Location(s):
Newark, NJ; (Hybrid)
Prudential Financial, Inc. (NYSE: PRU), a global financial services leader and premier active global investment manager with approximately $1.5 trillion in assets under management as of March 31, 2024, has operations in the United States, Asia, Europe, and Latin America. Prudential’s diverse and talented employees help make lives better and create financial opportunity for more people by expanding access to investing, insurance, and retirement security. Prudential’s iconic Rock symbol has stood for strength, stability, expertise, and innovation for nearly 150 years. For more information, please visit news.prudential.com
Are you looking for a career that helps you apply your love of capital markets, data analysis, and investments to inform business strategy and work with diverse teams on challenging projects? Are you interested in being a part of an exciting program that is focused on developing technical and professional skills while collaborating alongside leaders in the investment community? If you are results driven, have a passion for working with numbers, and are deeply technical and highly innovative, then Prudential’s Chief Investment Office (CIO) Analyst Program is the role for you!
The Chief Investment Office (CIO) is a major strategic partner to many other departments across the enterprise and relies upon a collaborative culture to effectively create both micro and macro solutions to the most interesting challenges at Prudential. With over $400 billion in assets under management as of 12/31/2022, the CIO is responsible for asset/liability (ALM) management, interest rate risk management, oversight and reporting on product investment margin performance and related hedge management activities. The CIO controls the management of the investment portfolios of Prudential’s General Accounts through its Alternative Assets Group and Global Hedge Management team within Prudential Select Strategies LLC, an SEC registered investment adviser, and its U.S. and International Portfolio groups, and Global Investment Strategy team.
Timeline:
We review applications on a rolling basis, and we encourage you to apply as soon as you are ready. All fall applications will close on or by Friday, October 4th, 2024, at midnight ET. We reserve the right to close applications early due to volume or role(s) being filled.*Applications for PGIM Investment Professional roles are open as of July 1st. All other businesses will open on August 2nd**.* To ensure you are considered for the opportunities you want most, you are only able to apply to 3 positions per recruitment season.
Your Day to Day:
The CIO Analyst Program is a three-year, entry-level role within the Chief Investment Office. Our program provides exposure to multiple pockets of a dynamic organization while creating the opportunity for success and recognition through substantial and long-term business impact.
Placements will vary across the business, some experiences within our CIO Analyst Program could include:
Alternative Assets Team within Prudential Select Strategies (PSS) – Prudential Select Strategies LLC is a registered investment adviser that originates, underwrites, and manages a diversified portfolio of fund investments to maximize risk-adjusted return on required capital. The Alternative Assets Team within Prudential Select Strategies is organized into the following asset classes and teams: Private Equity, Hedge Funds, Real Assets, Manager of Managers, Operational Due Diligence, and Risk Management.
Global Hedge Management (GHM) – GHM provides comprehensive hedging solutions and efficient trade execution. The team utilizes its capital markets acumen and liability knowledge to implement and manage multiple hedge programs for the CIO. Some of GHM’s responsibilities include Trading & Hedge Management, Hedge Strategy, Marketing & Production Development, and Managerial Analytics.
U.S. Portfolio Management (USPM) – The U.S. Portfolio Management (USPM) group is the portfolio manager responsible for managing Prudential’s proprietary U.S. investment portfolios. USPM develops asset-liability management-oriented portfolio strategies that include target levels of interest rate exposure and asset allocation among various public and private fixed income sectors and alternative assets. USPM implements these portfolio strategies by selecting, directing, and overseeing asset managers with scale and demonstrated expertise in the management of specific asset classes.
International Portfolio Management (IPM) – (IPM) is the portfolio manager responsible for managing Prudential’s proprietary international investment portfolios. IPM develops asset-liability management-oriented portfolio strategies that include target levels of interest rate exposure and asset allocation among various public and private fixed income sectors and alternative assets. IPM implement these portfolio strategies by selecting, directing, and overseeing asset managers with scale and demonstrated expertise in the management of specific asset classes.
Global Investment Strategy (GIS) – The GIS group is responsible for the broad investment strategy and portfolio management across the varying legal entities and portfolios. The development of the enterprise investment strategy includes key inputs such as market and strategic initiatives, ALM strategy and analytics as well as credit risk portfolio management. In addition, the flexibility of the non-AOI portfolios allows implementation of total rate of return strategies to significantly enhance economic value.
Required Qualifications:* Candidates must be enrolled in an accredited bachelor’s program graduating between December 2024 and May 2025
* Preferred majors include mathematics, engineering, economics, computer science, finance, actuarial sciences, or a similarly quantitative subject area.
* Minimum 3.0 GPA recommended
* Prudential does not provide visa sponsorship for this position. Successful candidates must possess the requisite US employment authorization to be eligible for consideration


Preferred Qualifications:* Strong written, oral communication, and interpersonal skills
* Advanced proficiency in Excel
* Excellent leadership and interpersonal skills


Our Application Process:
Submit your application. If eligible, receive invitation for a digital interview; this includes answering pre-recorded interview questions with the business(es) that advance your application(s). If advanced, receive invitation for final round interview(s); you will have the opportunity to meet with us in person or virtually to learn more about our business and culture.
For 2025 early talent roles, our process is designed to help you learn more about Prudential/PGIM and share your story with us. Digital interviewing allows greater flexibility, enables a quicker interview process, allows us to meet more candidates and share your story with more members of the team.
Note: The salary range for this role is $80,000 to $85,000. Specific pricing for the role may vary within the above range based on many factors including geographic location, candidate experience, and skills. Roles may also be eligible for additional compensation and/or benefits. Eligibility to participate in a discretionary annual incentive program is subject to the rules governing the program, whereby an award, if any, depends on various factors including, without limitation, individual and organizational performance.

title: Prudential: 2025 Corporate, Risk Management Internship Program
description:
Job Classification:
Corporate - Risk
Prudential: 2025 Risk Management Internship Program
Location(s):
Newark, NJ (Hybrid)
Prudential Financial, Inc. (NYSE: PRU), a global financial services leader and premier active global investment manager with approximately $1.5 trillion in assets under management as of March 31, 2024, has operations in the United States, Asia, Europe, and Latin America. Prudential’s diverse and talented employees help make lives better and create financial opportunity for more people by expanding access to investing, insurance, and retirement security. Prudential’s iconic Rock symbol has stood for strength, stability, expertise, and innovation for nearly 150 years. For more information, please visit news.prudential.com.
Are you an on-campus leader who wants to apply your curious mind to problem-solving, trend research, and data analysis to make an impact within a dynamic, evolving organization? Or maybe you’re looking to gain foundational knowledge and skills to apply in a professional environment, while developing strong relationships through training, mentorship, and ongoing feedback. At Prudential that’s a challenge we can help you meet as a member of our Risk Management Internship.
Think for a second how the following recent headlines could affect Prudential’s businesses:* “New Weapons Against Cancer: Millions of Bacteria Programmed to Kill”
* “Interest Rates Just Keep Falling. Economic Orthodoxy Is Falling With Them”
* “COVID-19 Worldwide: The Pandemic’s Impact On The Economy And Markets”


Enterprise Risk Management (ERM) helps ensure that Prudential has a comprehensive framework for understanding the risks embedded in and across its businesses, so that the company can manage these risks effectively, evaluate current and future risk challenges and opportunities, and enhance shareholder value. Risk Management is at the heart of how Prudential thrives during the constant evolution of the financial and insurance industries, in advances in technology and biometrics, and through changes in global economies and governmental laws. In our summer internship program, you will gain exposure to a core function of Risk Management while receiving technical and professional skills training and partnering with leaders to help inform business strategy.
Timeline:
The internship program will run from Monday, June 2nd, 2025, to Friday, August 8th, 2025.
We review applications on a rolling basis, and we encourage you to apply as soon as you are ready. All fall applications will close on or by Friday, October 4th, 2024, at midnight ET. We reserve the right to close applications early due to volume or role(s) being filled.*Applications for PGIM Investment Professional roles are open as of July 1st. All other businesses will open on August 2nd.* To ensure you are considered for the opportunities you want most, you are only able to apply to 3 positions per recruitment season.
Your Day to Day:
Placements will vary across the business, some experiences within our Risk Management Internship Program could include:* Insurance Risk Management: Insurance Risk Management is concerned with Prudential’s long-term liabilities we have through our insurance and retirement products. For example, an intern on our Biometrics Landscape team within Insurance Risk would research scientific papers on advances in disease cures, and present findings for leadership so that our Insurance businesses can understand how life-expectancy for our customer base may change.
* Financial Markets Risk Management: The pillars of this function are risk quantification, risk constraints (limits), credit analysis, and strategic review of sectors and trends. An RMDP might be involved by looking at data from Rating Agencies on corporate credit worthiness and use that analysis to review and critique our ongoing investment inputs (where we’re investing our assets!). Or you may be evaluating the potential impact on the Company of a range of coherent, multi-year stress scenarios, chosen to examine the Company’s significant risk exposures, and consistent in severity with a rational interpretation of “worst-in-history” experience. This team also monitors changes to market prices that affect our portfolios and may cause asset-liability mismatching (they make sure we have enough money to pay claims when we need to!). An RMDP analyst would produce and present daily, weekly, monthly, and quarterly reports on our derivative trading positions, to inform leadership on new market sensitivities.
* Operational Risk Management: Each one of Prudential’s businesses and corporate functions has specific operational practices (people, processes, systems, and events) that affect how they achieve their goals. Operational Risk specialists develop assessments, analyze events, and manage issues to ensure these practices don’t fail us in execution. For example, an intern might discuss the overall risk profile of the Annuities Business with leaders in order to understand and enhance systems used by the business that ultimately benefit the end customer experience.


Our Risk Internship is just one part of the larger enterprise-wide program that is made up of over 300 interns across the country. You will be joining a collaborative and inclusive corporate climate and will be matched with a mentor from our full-time rotational program, the Risk Management Development Program (RMDP). Rising seniors are eligible for offers to join the RMDP as a full-time employee. Rising juniors are eligible for offers to return for a second summer internship in a different Risk function.
Required Qualifications:* Candidates must be enrolled in an accredited bachelor’s program graduating between December 2025 and May 2027
* All majors are welcome to apply!
* Minimum 3.0 GPA strongly preferred
* Prudential does not provide visa sponsorship for this position. Successful candidates must possess the requisite US employment authorization to be eligible for consideration


Preferred Qualifications:* We look for the following key competencies, instead of specific majors:
	+ Ability to balance competing agendas
	+ Familiar and comfortable with quantitative and qualitative analysis
	+ Ability to manage complexity in assignments
	+ Inclined to challenge the status quo…constructively!
* Strong written, oral communication, and interpersonal skills.
* Mathematical aptitude and computer skills are helpful.


Our Application Process:
Submit your application. If eligible, receive invitation for a digital interview; this includes answering pre-recorded interview questions with the business(es) that advance your application(s). If advanced, receive invitation for final round interview(s); you will have the opportunity to meet with us in person or virtually to learn more about our business and culture.
For 2025 early talent roles, our process is designed to help you learn more about Prudential/PGIM and share your story with us. Digital interviewing allows greater flexibility, enables a quicker interview process, allows us to meet more candidates and share your story with more members of the team.
Note: The salary range for this role is [$32.00 to $35.00]. Specific pricing for the role may vary within the above range based on many factors including geographic location, candidate experience, and skills. Roles may also be eligible for additional compensation and/or benefits. Eligibility to participate in a discretionary annual incentive program is subject to the rules governing the program, whereby an award, if any, depends on various factors including, without limitation, individual and organizational performance.

Are you looking for a career where you can apply your love of project management, problem solving, and data to inform business strategy and work with diverse teams on challenging projects? Are you interested in being a part of an exciting internship program that is focused on developing technical and professional skills while collaborating alongside leaders across the organization? If you are results driven, have a passion for working with teams, and are highly innovative, then Prudential’s US Businesses Internship Program is the place for you!
The U.S. Businesses include Individual Life Insurance, Group Insurance, Retirement Strategies, and Retail Advice & Solutions, and Marketing. These businesses provide a range of income, protection, and advice offerings. They are supported by the USB Center organization delivering an end-to-end customer experience that's simple, proactive, and data-driven to fuel financial wellness solutions for our customers.
Timeline:
The internship program will run from Monday, June 2nd, 2025, to Friday, August 8th, 2025.
We review applications on a rolling basis, and we encourage you to apply as soon as you are ready. All fall applications will close on or by Friday, October 4th, 2024, at midnight ET. We reserve the right to close applications early due to volume or role(s) being filled.*Applications for PGIM Investment Professional roles are open as of July 1st. All other businesses will open on August 2nd**.* To ensure you are considered for the opportunities you want most, you are only able to apply to 3 positions per recruitment season.
Your Day to Day:
You will be empowered to contribute in a meaningful way, add new value to organization initiatives and effect change. Your placement within the US Businesses Internship Program could be in one of the following areas:* Underwriting (Minneapolis, MN; Hybrid, Virtual) – Underwriting opportunities are a part of our Individual Life Insurance function. Prudential’s Individual Life Insurance group focuses on offering competitive solutions to meet the needs of consumers through the manufacturing and distribution of a diverse portfolio of life insurance products.
* Sales (Newark, NJ, Ft. Wash, MD; Hybrid) – Sales opportunities are apart of our below functions:
	+ Group Insurance - Prudential’s Group Insurance manufactures and distributes a full range of group life, long-term and short-term group disability, voluntary, and group corporate, bank and trust owned life insurance in the U.S. primarily to institutional clients for use in connection with employer plans and affinity groups.
	+ Retirement Strategies - The Retirement Strategies team at Prudential delivers industry-leading solutions for growth and protection to more than 2 million individual and institutional customers. The Retirement Strategies business is comprised of Individual Retirement Strategies and Institutional Retirement Strategies.
* Operations (Newark, NJ; Hybrid) – Operations opportunities are a part of our Group Insurance function. Prudential’s Group Insurance manufactures and distributes a full range of group life, long-term and short-term group disability, voluntary, and group corporate, bank and trust owned life insurance in the U.S. primarily to institutional clients for use in connection with employer plans and affinity groups.


Required Qualifications:* Candidates must be enrolled in an accredited bachelor’s program graduating between December 2025 and May 2027
* Preferred areas of study: Business, Economics, Management, Business Analytics, Operations, Entrepreneurship
* Prudential does not provide visa sponsorship for this position. Successful candidates must possess the requisite US employment authorization to be eligible for consideration


Preferred Qualifications:* Excellent work ethic and self-motivated with the ability to prioritize/meet deadlines
* Excellent customer service and communication (oral and written) skills
* Excellent leadership and interpersonal skills
* Strong critical thinking and analytical skills
* Proficient in Microsoft Office Suite including Excel, PowerPoint, etc.


Our Application Process:
Submit your application. If eligible, receive invitation for a digital interview; this includes answering pre-recorded interview questions with the business(es) that advance your application(s). If advanced, receive invitation for final round interview(s); you will have the opportunity to meet with us in person or virtually to learn more about our business and culture.
For 2025 early talent roles, our process is designed to help you learn more about Prudential/PGIM and share your story with us. Digital interviewing allows greater flexibility, enables a quicker interview process, allows us to meet more candidates and share your story with more members of the team.
Note: The salary range for this role is $28.00 to $34.00. Specific pricing for the role may vary within the above range based on many factors including geographic location, candidate experience, and skills. Roles may also be eligible for additional compensation and/or benefits. Eligibility to participate in a discretionary annual incentive program is subject to the rules governing the program, whereby an award, if any, depends on various factors including, without limitation, individual and organizational performance.

The company's well-known Rock symbol is an icon of strength, stability, expertise and innovation that has stood the test of time. Prudential's businesses offer a variety of products and services, including life insurance, annuities, retirement-related services, mutual funds, asset management, and real estate services.
We recognize that our strength and success are directly linked to the quality and skills of our diverse associates. We are proud to be a place where talented people who want to make a difference can grow as professionals, leaders, and as individuals. Visit www.prudential.com to learn more about our values, our history and our brand.

title: Prudential: 2025 Corporate, Finance Internship Program
description:
Job Classification:
Finance & Accounting - Finance & Accounting
Prudential: 2025 Corporate, Finance Internship Program (FIP)
Location(s):
Newark, NJ; Hartford, CT (Hybrid)
Prudential Financial, Inc. (NYSE: PRU), a global financial services leader and premier active global investment manager with approximately $1.5 trillion in assets under management as of March 31, 2024, has operations in the United States, Asia, Europe, and Latin America. Prudential’s diverse and talented employees help make lives better and create financial opportunity for more people by expanding access to investing, insurance, and retirement security. Prudential’s iconic Rock symbol has stood for strength, stability, expertise, and innovation for nearly 150 years. For more information, please visit news.prudential.com.
Are you a junior or senior looking to apply your Finance, Accounting and/or tech systems knowledge to achieve strategic goals in a corporate finance organization? Or maybe you’re looking to gain foundational knowledge and skills to apply in a professional environment, while developing strong relationships through training, mentorship, and ongoing feedback. At Prudential that’s a challenge we can help you meet as a member of our Finance Internship Program (FIP).
The vision of Global Finance is to be the preeminent Finance team in Financial Services. Our Mission is to enable superior value propositions for Customers, Investors and Employees. We support business growth strategies & initiatives within U.S. Financial Wellness, PGIM, and International. As an intern in FIP, you could find yourself in a line of business or a Corporate Finance function, analyzing data while working side-by-side with Finance Leadership Development Program (FLDP) Associates and business leaders. As an FIP intern, you are given substantial responsibilities and will have the opportunity to present your newly learned skills to your team during this 10-week experience. The goal of this internship is to identify top talent for our FLDP.
FLDP is our full-time, rotational program in Corporate Finance, and focuses on developing future leaders by combining on‐the‐job training with formal training classes, special project assignments, mentoring and coaching. We offer competitive compensation & sign‐on bonus; possible placement locations include New Jersey and Connecticut.
Timeline:
The internship program will run from Monday, June 2nd, 2025, to Friday, August 8th, 2025.
We review applications on a rolling basis, and we encourage you to apply as soon as you are ready. All fall applications will close on or by Friday, October 4th, 2024, at midnight ET. title: Interpretation Technician
description:
* New York, New York, United States
* Language Services
* Part-time


  
###### **Description:**


**Acolad is the global leader in content and language solutions. Its mission is to support companies in every industry to scale across markets and enable growth through cutting-edge technology and localization expertise. Established in 1993, the group is present in 23 countries across Europe, North America, and Asia, with over 1.800 employees supported by a network of +20.000 linguists around the world.**

**At Acolad, every position is key to our global growth: we know that we will only succeed if our people succeed.**

**Joining Acolad means a unique opportunity for professional development through a collaborative global environment that promotes talent and creativity. We are continuously looking for new talent (like you!) to support our mission to drive growth and innovation across some of the world’s leading brands.**

**Main Purpose**


The main purpose of this role is to provide onsite support for setup, operation and tear down of interpretation equipment and client liaison for interpreters and clients for live events.

 **Main Responsibilities**

* Provide proper care and management of the equipment
* Conduct an inventory before and after the event.
* Report equipment or client problems when they occur.
* Label broken equipment for diagnosis and repair.
* Report loss of equipment immediately after event, if applicable.
* Provide professional and timely service to all clients.
* Effectively communicate with team members and arrive on time.
* Manage the budget for the event and report hours and expenses to manager.
###### **Requirements:**


**Educational Background:**

* High school or audio-visual school graduate preferred, but not required.

**Professional Experience:**

* Experience working Audio Visual and Interpretation equipment is a plus.
* Professional (business attire) dress code for events/business casual for set up.
* On-Time Management a must.
* Ability to learn to operate, set up, and tear down interpretation equipment.
* Customer service skills
* Experience working with PCs, Zoom and basic networking is a plus
* Ability to lift/push/pull a minimum of 35 lbs.
* English speaking - additional languages a plus
###### **Benefits:**


* Working with a great team of individuals.

**Acolad is committed to creating a diverse and equitable workforce. We believe that diversity, equity, and inclusion in all its forms—gender, age, disability, marital status, ethnic or social origin, religion, belief, or sexual orientation—enrich the workplace. It opens opportunities for individuals to express their talents, both individually and collectively, and strengthens our ability to adapt to a changing world. As an equal opportunity employer, we welcome and consider applications from all qualified candidates, regardless of their backgrounds.**

*This opportunity will close Oct. 31, 2024*

*Hourly rate for this role is $18.00.*

title: Manager, Order Managment
description:
**Working with Us**  

Challenging. Meaningful. Life-changing. Those aren't words that are usually associated with a job. But working at Bristol Myers Squibb is anything but usual. Here, uniquely interesting work happens every day, in every department. From optimizing a production line to the latest breakthroughs in cell therapy, this is work that transforms the lives of patients, and the careers of those who do it. You'll get the chance to grow and thrive through opportunities uncommon in scale and scope, alongside high-achieving teams rich in diversity. Take your career farther than you thought possible.  

  

Bristol Myers Squibb recognizes the importance of balance and flexibility in our work environment. We offer a wide variety of competitive benefits, services and programs that provide our employees with the resources to pursue their goals, both at work and in their personal lives. Read more: careers.bms.com/working-with-us .  

  

**Role:** Manager, Order Management  

  

You will be part of BMS global cell therapy order management team supporting daily operational activities and ERP implementation projects.
  

  

Your primary job responsibility will be to monitor Cell Therapy Transaction Orchestration order management documents, manage returns, replacements, retreatments and any other order exceptions. You must be a highly motivated individual to quickly learn order exception management process and support order exception management activities working with internal and external stakeholders.
  

  

**Responsibilities will include, but are not limited to the following:*** Monitor the automatic creation of documents including sales orders and purchase orders inside ERP and act on any exceptions that might occur.
* Be in constant communication with Production Planning, Scheduling and Cell Logistics, BMS Commercial organizations and Specialty Distributer to resolve any order exception to ensure on-time delivery.
* Monitor the receipt of Proof of Delivery to ensure the invoices are generated in a timely manner.
* Collaborate with IT and MDM team to resolve any master data related issues.
* Collaborate with IT to resolve any technical ERP issues in real time to ensure no supply interruption occurs.
* Collaborate with BMS CAR T VAP team and Specialty Distributers to resolve order reconciliation issues.
* Act as Order Management SME for implementation of ERP systems at new and existing manufacturing sites.
* Collaborate with business partners for Order Exception Management and Cross functional process mapping.
* Collaborate with BMS Commercial and Finance teams to issue credit and resolve any sale order and AP/AR related issues.
* Performs User Acceptance Testing for quarterly releases and new ERP implementations.
* Maintain the Order Exception Management SOPs.
* Collaborate with BI&A team to build reports and dashboard for Order Management team.
* Analyze existing processes and look for opportunities for continuous improvements.
* Mentor and train junior members of the team.

**Skill and Knowledge Requirements:*** Bachelor's degree with 4+ years of experience
* Must be highly organized and detailed oriented
* Must be able to prioritize multiple competing tasks and deadlines while working in a fast-paced environment
* Prior experience with Order Management (OTC) and ERP systems preferably Oracle or SAP
* Strong communication (written and verbal) and customer service skills
* Strong business acumen
* Ability to work effectively both independently and as part of a team
* Flexibility in responding to change or business needs
* Proficient with O365 software especially Outlook, PowerPoint, Excel, Word


The starting compensation for this job is a range from $92,000 - $115,000,  

  

plus incentive cash and stock opportunities (based on eligibility). The starting pay rate takes into account characteristics of the job, such as required skills and the geographic location where work is performed. Final, individual compensation is decided commensurate with demonstrated experience. For more on benefits, please visit our BMS Careers Site. Eligibility for specific benefits listed therein may vary based on job and location.  

  

If you come across a role that intrigues you but doesn't perfectly line up with your resume, we encourage you to apply anyway. You could be one step away from work that will transform your life and career.
  

  

**Uniquely Interesting Work, Life-changing Careers**  

With a single vision as inspiring as Transforming patients' lives through science™ , every BMS employee plays an integral role in work that goes far beyond ordinary. Each of us is empowered to apply our individual talents and unique perspectives in an inclusive culture, promoting diversity in clinical trials, while our shared values of passion, innovation, urgency, accountability, inclusion and integrity bring out the highest potential of each of our colleagues.  

  

**On-site Protocol**  

  

BMS has a diverse occupancy structure that determines where an employee is required to conduct their work. This structure includes site-essential, site-by-design, field-based and remote-by-design jobs. The occupancy type that you are assigned is determined by the nature and responsibilities of your role:
  

  

Site-essential roles require 100% of shifts onsite at your assigned facility. Site-by-design roles may be eligible for a hybrid work model with at least 50% onsite at your assigned facility. For these roles, onsite presence is considered an essential job function and is critical to collaboration, innovation, productivity, and a positive Company culture. For field-based and remote-by-design roles the ability to physically travel to visit customers, patients or business partners and to attend meetings on behalf of BMS as directed is an essential job function.
  

  

BMS is dedicated to ensuring that people with disabilities can excel through a transparent recruitment process, reasonable workplace accommodations/adjustments and ongoing support in their roles. Applicants can request a reasonable workplace accommodation/adjustment prior to accepting a job offer. If you require reasonable accommodations/adjustments in completing this application, or in any part of the recruitment process, direct your inquiries to adastaffingsupport@bms.com . Visit careers.bms.com/ eeo -accessibility to access our complete Equal Employment Opportunity statement.
  

  

BMS cares about your well-being and the well-being of our staff, customers, patients, and communities. As a result, the Company strongly recommends that all employees be fully vaccinated for Covid-19 and keep up to date with Covid-19 boosters.
  

  

BMS will consider for employment qualified applicants with arrest and conviction records, pursuant to applicable laws in your area.  

  

Any data processed in connection with role applications will be treated in accordance with applicable data privacy policies and regulations.
